HED.prologue: This schema is the first official release that includes an xsd and requires unit class, unit modifier, value class, schema attribute and property sections.

node.name: Event
node.description: Something that happens at a given time and (typically) place. Elements of this tag subtree designate the general category in which an event falls.

node.name: Sensory-event
node.description: Something perceivable by the participant. An event meant to be an experimental stimulus should include the tag Task-property/Task-event-role/Experimental-stimulus.

node.name: Agent-action
node.description: Any action engaged in by an agent (see the Agent subtree for agent categories). A participant response to an experiment stimulus should include the tag Agent-property/Agent-task-role/Experiment-participant.

node.name: Data-feature
node.description: An event marking the occurrence of a data feature such as an interictal spike or alpha burst that is often added post hoc to the data record.

node.name: Experiment-control
node.description: An event pertaining to the physical control of the experiment during its operation.

node.name: Experiment-procedure
node.description: An event indicating an experimental procedure, as in performing a saliva swab during the experiment or administering a survey.

node.name: Experiment-structure
node.description: An event specifying a change-point of the structure of experiment. This event is typically used to indicate a change in experimental conditions or tasks.

node.name: Measurement-event
node.description: A discrete measure returned by an instrument.

node.name: Agent
node.description: Someone or something that takes an active role or produces a specified effect.The role or effect may be implicit. Being alive or performing an activity such as a computation may qualify something to be an agent. An agent may also be something that simulates something else.

node.name: Animal-agent
node.description: An agent that is an animal.

node.name: Avatar-agent
node.description: An agent associated with an icon or avatar representing another agent.

node.name: Controller-agent
node.description: An agent experiment control software or hardware.

node.name: Human-agent
node.description: A person who takes an active role or produces a specified effect.

node.name: Robotic-agent
node.description: An agent mechanical device capable of performing a variety of often complex tasks on command or by being programmed in advance.

node.name: Software-agent
node.description: An agent computer program.

node.name: Action
node.description: Do something.

node.name: Communicate
node.description: Convey knowledge of or information about something.

node.name: Communicate-gesturally
node.description: Communicate nonverbally using visible bodily actions, either in place of speech or together and in parallel with spoken words. Gestures include movement of the hands, face, or other parts of the body.

node.name: Clap-hands
node.description: Strike the palms of against one another resoundingly, and usually repeatedly, especially to express approval.

node.name: Clear-throat
node.description: Cough slightly so as to speak more clearly, attract attention, or to express hesitancy before saying something awkward.

node.name: Frown
node.description: Express disapproval, displeasure, or concentration, typically by turning down the corners of the mouth.

node.name: Grimace
node.description: Make a twisted expression, typically expressing disgust, pain, or wry amusement.

node.name: Nod-head
node.description: Tilt head in alternating up and down arcs along the sagittal plane. It is most commonly, but not universally, used to indicate agreement, acceptance, or acknowledgement.

node.name: Pump-fist
node.description: Raise with fist clenched in triumph or affirmation.

node.name: Raise-eyebrows
node.description: Move eyebrows upward.

node.name: Shake-fist
node.description: Clench hand into a fist and shake to demonstrate anger.

node.name: Shake-head
node.description: Turn head from side to side as a way of showing disagreement or refusal.

node.name: Shhh
node.description: Place finger over lips and possibly uttering the syllable shhh to indicate the need to be quiet.

node.name: Shrug
node.description: Lift shoulders up towards head to indicate a lack of knowledge about a particular topic.

node.name: Smile
node.description: Form facial features into a pleased, kind, or amused expression, typically with the corners of the mouth turned up and the front teeth exposed.

node.name: Spread-hands
node.description: Spread hands apart to indicate ignorance.

node.name: Thumbs-down
node.description: Extend the thumb downward to indicate disapproval.

node.name: Thumb-up
node.description: Extend the thumb upward to indicate approval.

node.name: Wave
node.description: Raise hand and move left and right, as a greeting or sign of departure.

node.name: Widen-eyes
node.description: Open eyes and possibly with eyebrows lifted especially to express surprise or fear.

node.name: Wink
node.description: Close and open one eye quickly, typically to indicate that something is a joke or a secret or as a signal of affection or greeting.

node.name: Communicate-musically
node.description: Communicate using music.

node.name: Hum
node.description: Make a low, steady continuous sound like that of a bee. Sing with the lips closed and without uttering speech.

node.name: Play-instrument
node.description: Make musical sounds using an instrument.

node.name: Sing
node.description: Produce musical tones by means of the voice.

node.name: Vocalize
node.description: Utter vocal sounds.

node.name: Whistle
node.description: Produce a shrill clear sound by forcing breath out or air in through the puckered lips.

node.name: Communicate-vocally
node.description: Communicate using mouth or vocal cords.

node.name: Cry
node.description: Shed tears associated with emotions, usually sadness but also joy or frustration.

node.name: Groan
node.description: Make a deep inarticulate sound in response to pain or despair.

node.name: Laugh
node.description: Make the spontaneous sounds and movements of the face and body that are the instinctive expressions of lively amusement and sometimes also of contempt or derision.

node.name: Scream
node.description: Make loud, vociferous cries or yells to express pain, excitement, or fear.

node.name: Shout
node.description: Say something very loudly.

node.name: Sigh
node.description: Emit a long, deep, audible breath expressing sadness, relief, tiredness, or a similar feeling.

node.name: Speak
node.description: Communicate using spoken language.

node.name: Whisper
node.description: Speak very softly using breath without vocal cords.

node.name: Move
node.description: Move in a specified direction or manner. Change position or posture.

node.name: Breathe
node.description: Inhale or exhale during respiration.

node.name: Blow
node.description: Expel air through pursed lips.

node.name: Cough
node.description: Suddenly and audibly expel air from the lungs through a partially closed glottis, preceded by inhalation.

node.name: Exhale
node.description: Blow out or expel breath.

node.name: Hiccup
node.description: Involuntarily spasm the diaphragm and respiratory organs, with a sudden closure of the glottis and a characteristic sound like that of a cough.

node.name: Hold-breath
node.description: Interrupt normal breathing by ceasing to inhale or exhale.

node.name: Inhale
node.description: Draw in with the breath through the nose or mouth.

node.name: Sneeze
node.description: Suddenly and violently expel breath through the nose and mouth.

node.name: Sniff
node.description: Draw in air audibly through the nose to detect a smell, to stop it from running, or to express contempt.

node.name: Move-body
node.description: Move entire body.

node.name: Bend
node.description: Move body in a bowed or curved manner.

node.name: Dance
node.description: Perform a purposefully selected sequences of human movement often with aesthetic or symbolic value. Move rhythmically to music, typically following a set sequence of steps.

node.name: Fall-down
node.description: Lose balance and collapse.

node.name: Flex
node.description: Cause a muscle to stand out by contracting or tensing it. Bend a limb or joint.

node.name: Jerk
node.description: Make a quick, sharp, sudden movement.

node.name: Lie-down
node.description: Move to a horizontal or resting position.

node.name: Recover-balance
node.description: Return to a stable, upright body position.

node.name: Sit-down
node.description: Move from a standing to a sitting position.

node.name: Sit-up
node.description: Move from lying down to a sitting position.

node.name: Stand-up
node.description: Move from a sitting to a standing position.

node.name: Stretch
node.description: Straighten or extend body or a part of body to its full length, typically so as to tighten muscles or in order to reach something.

node.name: Shudder
node.description: Tremble convulsively, sometimes as a result of fear or revulsion.

node.name: Stumble
node.description: Trip or momentarily lose balance and almost fall.

node.name: Turn
node.description: Change or cause to change direction.

node.name: Move-body-part
node.description: Move one part of a body.

node.name: Move-eyes
node.description: Move eyes.

node.name: Blink
node.description: Shut and open the eyes quickly.

node.name: Close-eyes
node.description: Lower and keep eyelids in a closed position.

node.name: Fixate
node.description: Direct eyes to a specific point or target.

node.name: Inhibit-blinks
node.description: Purposely prevent blinking.

node.name: Open-eyes
node.description: Raise eyelids to expose pupil.

node.name: Saccade
node.description: Move eyes rapidly between fixation points.

node.name: Squint
node.description: Squeeze one or both eyes partly closed in an attempt to see more clearly or as a reaction to strong light.

node.name: Stare
node.description: Look fixedly or vacantly at someone or something with eyes wide open.

node.name: Move-face
node.description: Move the face or jaw.

node.name: Bite
node.description: Seize with teeth or jaws an object or organism so as to grip or break the surface covering.

node.name: Burp
node.description: Noisily release air from the stomach through the mouth. Belch.

node.name: Chew
node.description: Repeatedly grinding, tearing, and or crushing with teeth or jaws.

node.name: Gurgle
node.description: Make a hollow bubbling sound like that made by water running out of a bottle.

node.name: Swallow
node.description: Cause or allow something, especially food or drink to pass down the throat.

node.name: Gulp
node.description: Swallow quickly or in large mouthfuls, often audibly, sometimes to indicate apprehension.

node.name: Yawn
node.description: Take a deep involuntary inhalation with the mouth open often as a sign of drowsiness or boredom.

node.name: Move-head
node.description: Move head.

node.name: Lift-head
node.description: Tilt head back lifting chin.

node.name: Lower-head
node.description: Move head downward so that eyes are in a lower position.

node.name: Turn-head
node.description: Rotate head horizontally to look in a different direction.

node.name: Move-lower-extremity
node.description: Move leg and/or foot.

node.name: Curl-toes
node.description: Bend toes sometimes to grip.

node.name: Hop
node.description: Jump on one foot.

node.name: Jog
node.description: Run at a trot to exercise.

node.name: Jump
node.description: Move off the ground or other surface through sudden muscular effort in the legs.

node.name: Kick
node.description: Strike out or flail with the foot or feet. Strike using the leg, in unison usually with an area of the knee or lower using the foot.

node.name: Pedal
node.description: Move by working the pedals of a bicycle or other machine.

node.name: Press-foot
node.description: Move by pressing foot.

node.name: Run
node.description: Travel on foot at a fast pace.

node.name: Step
node.description: Put one leg in front of the other and shift weight onto it.

node.name: Heel-strike
node.description: Strike the ground with the heel during a step.

node.name: Toe-off
node.description: Push with toe as part of a stride.

node.name: Trot
node.description: Run at a moderate pace, typically with short steps.

node.name: Walk
node.description: Move at a regular pace by lifting and setting down each foot in turn never having both feet off the ground at once.

node.name: Move-torso
node.description: Move body trunk.

node.name: Move-upper-extremity
node.description: Move arm, shoulder, and/or hand.

node.name: Drop
node.description: Let or cause to fall vertically.

node.name: Grab
node.description: Seize suddenly or quickly. Snatch or clutch.

node.name: Grasp
node.description: Seize and hold firmly.

node.name: Hold-down
node.description: Prevent someone or something from moving by holding them firmly.

node.name: Lift
node.description: Raising something to higher position.

node.name: Make-fist
node.description: Close hand tightly with the fingers bent against the palm.

node.name: Point
node.description: Draw attention to something by extending a finger or arm.

node.name: Press
node.description: Apply pressure to something to flatten, shape, smooth or depress it. This action tag should be used to indicate key presses and mouse clicks.

node.name: Push
node.description: Apply force in order to move something away. Use Press to indicate a key press or mouse click.

node.name: Reach
node.description: Stretch out your arm in order to get or touch something.

node.name: Release
node.description: Make available or set free.

node.name: Retract
node.description: Draw or pull back.

node.name: Scratch
node.description: Drag claws or nails over a surface or on skin.

node.name: Snap-fingers
node.description: Make a noise by pushing second finger hard against thumb and then releasing it suddenly so that it hits the base of the thumb.

node.name: Touch
node.description: Come into or be in contact with.

node.name: Perceive
node.description: Produce an internal, conscious image through stimulating a sensory system.

node.name: Hear
node.description: Give attention to a sound.

node.name: See
node.description: Direct gaze toward someone or something or in a specified direction.

node.name: Smell
node.description: Inhale in order to ascertain an odor or scent.

node.name: Taste
node.description: Sense a flavor in the mouth and throat on contact with a substance.

node.name: Sense-by-touch
node.description: Sense something through receptors in the skin.

node.name: Perform
node.description: Carry out or accomplish an action, task, or function.

node.name: Close
node.description: Act as to blocked against entry or passage.

node.name: Collide-with
node.description: Hit with force when moving.

node.name: Halt
node.description: Bring or come to an abrupt stop.

node.name: Modify
node.description: Change something.

node.name: Open
node.description: Widen an aperture, door, or gap, especially one allowing access to something.

node.name: Operate
node.description: Control the functioning of a machine, process, or system.

node.name: Play
node.description: Engage in activity for enjoyment and recreation rather than a serious or practical purpose.

node.name: Read
node.description: Interpret something that is written or printed.

node.name: Repeat
node.description: Make do or perform again.

node.name: Rest
node.description: Be inactive in order to regain strength, health, or energy.

node.name: Write
node.description: Communicate or express by means of letters or symbols written or imprinted on a surface.

node.name: Think
node.description: Direct the mind toward someone or something or use the mind actively to form connected ideas.

node.name: Allow
node.description: Allow access to something such as allowing a car to pass.

node.name: Attend-to
node.description: Focus mental experience on specific targets.

node.name: Count
node.description: Tally items either silently or aloud.

node.name: Deny
node.description: Refuse to give or grant something requested or desired by someone.

node.name: Detect
node.description: Discover or identify the presence or existence of something.

node.name: Discriminate
node.description: Recognize a distinction.

node.name: Encode
node.description: Convert information or an instruction into a particular form.

node.name: Evade
node.description: Escape or avoid, especially by cleverness or trickery.

node.name: Generate
node.description: Cause something, especially an emotion or situation to arise or come about.

node.name: Identify
node.description: Establish or indicate who or what someone or something is.

node.name: Imagine
node.description: Form a mental image or concept of something.

node.name: Judge
node.description: Evaluate evidence to make a decision or form a belief.

node.name: Learn
node.description: Adaptively change behavior as the result of experience.

node.name: Memorize
node.description: Adaptively change behavior as the result of experience.

node.name: Plan
node.description: Think about the activities required to achieve a desired goal.

node.name: Predict
node.description: Say or estimate that something will happen or will be a consequence of something without having exact informaton.

node.name: Recognize
node.description: Identify someone or something from having encountered them before.

node.name: Respond
node.description: React to something such as a treatment or a stimulus.

node.name: Recall
node.description: Remember information by mental effort.

node.name: Switch-attention
node.description: Transfer attention from one focus to another.

node.name: Track
node.description: Follow a person, animal, or object through space or time.

node.name: Item
node.description: An independently existing thing (living or nonliving).

node.name: Biological-item
node.description: An entity that is biological, that is related to living organisms.

node.name: Anatomical-item
node.description: A biological structure, system, fluid or other substance excluding single molecular entities.

node.name: Body-part
node.description: Any part of an organism.

node.name: Head
node.description: The upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs.

node.name: Hair
node.description: The filamentous outgrowth of the epidermis.

node.name: Ear
node.description: A sense organ needed for the detection of sound and for establishing balance.

node.name: Face
node.description: The anterior portion of the head extending from the forehead to the chin and ear to ear. The facial structures contain the eyes, nose and mouth, cheeks and jaws.

node.name: Cheek
node.description: The fleshy part of the face bounded by the eyes, nose, ear, and jaw line.

node.name: Chin
node.description: The part of the face below the lower lip and including the protruding part of the lower jaw.

node.name: Eye
node.description: The organ of sight or vision.

node.name: Eyebrow
node.description: The arched strip of hair on the bony ridge above each eye socket.

node.name: Forehead
node.description: The part of the face between the eyebrows and the normal hairline.

node.name: Lip
node.description: Fleshy fold which surrounds the opening of the mouth.

node.name: Nose
node.description: A structure of special sense serving as an organ of the sense of smell and as an entrance to the respiratory tract.

node.name: Mouth
node.description: The proximal portion of the digestive tract, containing the oral cavity and bounded by the oral opening.

node.name: Teeth
node.description: The hard bonelike structures in the jaws. A collection of teeth arranged in some pattern in the mouth or other part of the body.

node.name: Lower-extremity
node.description: Refers to the whole inferior limb (leg and/or foot).

node.name: Ankle
node.description: A gliding joint between the distal ends of the tibia and fibula and the proximal end of the talus.

node.name: Calf
node.description: The fleshy part at the back of the leg below the knee.

node.name: Foot
node.description: The structure found below the ankle joint required for locomotion.

node.name: Big-toe
node.description: The largest toe on the inner side of the foot.

node.name: Heel
node.description: The back of the foot below the ankle.

node.name: Instep
node.description: The part of the foot between the ball and the heel on the inner side.

node.name: Little-toe
node.description: The smallest toe located on the outer side of the foot.

node.name: Toes
node.description: The terminal digits of the foot.

node.name: Knee
node.description: A joint connecting the lower part of the femur with the upper part of the tibia.

node.name: Shin
node.description: Front part of the leg below the knee.

node.name: Thigh
node.description: Upper part of the leg between hip and knee.

node.name: Torso
node.description: The body excluding the head and neck and limbs.

node.name: Torso-back
node.description: The rear surface of the human body from the shoulders to the hips.

node.name: Buttocks
node.description: The round fleshy parts that form the lower rear area of a human trunk.

node.name: Torso-chest
node.description: The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen.

node.name: Gentalia
node.description: The external organs of reproduction.

node.name: Hip
node.description: The lateral prominence of the pelvis from the waist to the thigh.

node.name: Waist
node.description: The abdominal circumference at the navel.

node.name: Upper-extremity
node.description: Refers to the whole superior limb (shoulder, arm, elbow, wrist, hand).

node.name: Elbow
node.description: A type of hinge joint located between the forearm and upper arm.

node.name: Forearm
node.description: Lower part of the arm between the elbow and wrist.

node.name: Hand
node.description: The distal portion of the upper extremity. It consists of the carpus, metacarpus, and digits.

node.name: Finger
node.description: Any of the digits of the hand.

node.name: Index-finger
node.description: The second finger from the radial side of the hand, next to the thumb.

node.name: Little-finger
node.description: The fifth and smallest finger from the radial side of the hand.

node.name: Middle-finger
node.description: The middle or third finger from the radial side of the hand.

node.name: Ring-finger
node.description: The fourth finger from the radial side of the hand.

node.name: Thumb
node.description: The thick and short hand digit which is next to the index finger in humans.

node.name: Palm
node.description: The part of the inner surface of the hand that extends from the wrist to the bases of the fingers.

node.name: Knuckles
node.description: A part of a finger at a joint where the bone is near the surface, especially where the finger joins the hand.

node.name: Shoulder
node.description: Joint attaching upper arm to trunk.

node.name: Upper-arm
node.description: Portion of arm between shoulder and elbow.

node.name: Wrist
node.description: A joint between the distal end of the radius and the proximal row of carpal bones.

node.name: Organism
node.description: A living entity, more specifically a biological entity that consists of one or more cells and is capable of genomic replication (independently or not).

node.name: Animal
node.description: A living organism that has membranous cell walls, requires oxygen and organic foods, and is capable of voluntary movement.

node.name: Human
node.description: The bipedal primate mammal Homo sapiens.

node.name: Plant
node.description: Any living organism that typically synthesizes its food from inorganic substances and possesses cellulose cell walls.

node.name: Language-item
node.description: An entity related to a systematic means of communicating by the use of sounds, symbols, or gestures.

node.name: Character
node.description: A mark or symbol used in writing.

node.name: Clause
node.description: A unit of grammatical organization next below the sentence in rank, usually consisting of a subject and predicate.

node.name: Glyph
node.description: A hieroglyphic character, symbol, or pictograph.

node.name: Nonword
node.description: A group of letters or speech sounds that looks or sounds like a word but that is not accepted as such by native speakers.

node.name: Paragraph
node.description: A distinct section of a piece of writing, usually dealing with a single theme.

node.name: Phoneme
node.description: A speech sound that is distinguished by the speakers of a particular language.

node.name: Phrase
node.description: A phrase is a group of words functioning as a single unit in the syntax of a sentence.

node.name: Sentence
node.description: A set of words that is complete in itself, conveying a statement, question, exclamation, or command and typically containing an explicit or implied subject and a predicate containing a finite verb.

node.name: Syllable
node.description: A unit of spoken language larger than a phoneme.

node.name: Textblock
node.description: A block of text.

node.name: Word
node.description: A word is the smallest free form (an item that may be expressed in isolation with semantic or pragmatic content) in a language.

node.name: Object
node.description: Something perceptible by one or more of the senses, especially by vision or touch. A material thing.

node.name: Geometric-object
node.description: An object or a representation that has structure and topology in space.

node.name: Pattern
node.description: An arrangement of objects, facts, behaviors, or other things which have scientific, mathematical, geometric, statistical, or other meaning.

node.name: Dots
node.description: A small round mark or spot.

node.name: LED-pattern
node.description: A pattern created by lighting selected members of a fixed light emitting diode array.

node.name: 2D-shape
node.description: A planar, two-dimensional shape.

node.name: Clockface
node.description: The dial face of a clock. A location identifier based on clockface numbering or anatomic subregion.

node.name: Cross
node.description: A figure or mark formed by two intersecting lines crossing at their midpoints.

node.name: Dash
node.description: A horizontal stroke in writing or printing to mark a pause or break in sense or to represent omitted letters or words.

node.name: Ellipse
node.description: A closed plane curve resulting from the intersection of a circular cone and a plane cutting completely through it, especially a plane not parallel to the base.

node.name: Circle
node.description: A ring-shaped structure with every point equidistant from the center.

node.name: Rectangle
node.description: A parallelogram with four right angles.

node.name: Square
node.description: A square is a special rectangle with four equal sides.

node.name: Single-point
node.description: A point is a geometric entity that is located in a zero-dimensional spatial region and whose position is defined by its coordinates in some coordinate system.

node.name: Star
node.description: A conventional or stylized representation of a star, typically one having five or more points.

node.name: Triangle
node.description: A three-sided polygon.

node.name: 3D-shape
node.description: A geometric three-dimensional shape.

node.name: Box
node.description: A square or rectangular vessel, usually made of cardboard or plastic.

node.name: Cube
node.description: A solid or semi-solid in the shape of a three dimensional square.

node.name: Cone
node.description: A shape whose base is a circle and whose sides taper up to a point.

node.name: Cylinder
node.description: A surface formed by circles of a given radius that are contained in a plane perpendicular to a given axis, whose centers align on the axis.

node.name: Ellipsoid
node.description: A closed plane curve resulting from the intersection of a circular cone and a plane cutting completely through it, especially a plane not parallel to the base.

node.name: Sphere
node.description: A solid or hollow three-dimensional object bounded by a closed surface such that every point on the surface is equidistant from the center.

node.name: Pyramid
node.description: A polyhedron of which one face is a polygon of any number of sides, and the other faces are triangles with a common vertex.

node.name: Ingestible-object
node.description: Something that can be taken into the body by the mouth for digestion or absorption.

node.name: Man-made-object
node.description: Something constructed by human means.

node.name: Building
node.description: A structure that has a roof and walls and stands more or less permanently in one place.

node.name: Room
node.description: An area within a building enclosed by walls and floor and ceiling.

node.name: Roof
node.description: A roof is the covering on the uppermost part of a building which provides protection from animals and weather, notably rain, but also heat, wind and sunlight.

node.name: Entrance
node.description: The means or place of entry.

node.name: Attic
node.description: A room or a space immediately below the roof of a building.

node.name: Basement
node.description: The part of a building that is wholly or partly below ground level.

node.name: Clothing
node.description: A covering designed to be worn on the body.

node.name: Device
node.description: An object contrived for a specific purpose.

node.name: Assistive-device
node.description: A device that help an individual accomplish a task.

node.name: Glasses
node.description: Frames with lenses worn in front of the eye for vision correction, eye protection, or protection from UV rays.

node.name: Writing-device
node.description: A device used for writing.

node.name: Pen
node.description: A common writing instrument used to apply ink to a surface for writing or drawing.

node.name: Pencil
node.description: An implement for writing or drawing that is constructed of a narrow solid pigment core in a protective casing that prevents the core from being broken or marking the hand.

node.name: Computing-device
node.description: An electronic device which take inputs and processes results from the inputs.

node.name: Cellphone
node.description: A telephone with access to a cellular radio system so it can be used over a wide area, without a physical connection to a network.

node.name: Desktop-computer
node.description: A computer suitable for use at an ordinary desk.

node.name: Laptop-computer
node.description: A computer that is portable and suitable for use while traveling.

node.name: Tablet-computer
node.description: A small portable computer that accepts input directly on to its screen rather than via a keyboard or mouse.

node.name: Engine
node.description: A motor is a machine designed to convert one or more forms of energy into mechanical energy.

node.name: IO-device
node.description: Hardware used by a human (or other system) to communicate with a computer.

node.name: Input-device
node.description: A piece of equipment used to provide data and control signals to an information processing system such as a computer or information appliance.

node.name: Computer-mouse
node.description: A hand-held pointing device that detects two-dimensional motion relative to a surface.

node.name: Mouse-button
node.description: An electric switch on a computer mouse which can be pressed or clicked to select or interact with an element of a graphical user interface.

node.name: Scroll-wheel
node.description: A scroll wheel or mouse wheel is a wheel used for scrolling made of hard plastic with a rubbery surface usually located between the left and right mouse buttons and is positioned perpendicular to the mouse surface.

node.name: Joystick
node.description: A control device that uses a movable handle to create two-axis input for a computer device.

node.name: Keyboard
node.description: A device consisting of mechanical keys that are pressed to create input to a computer.

node.name: Keyboard-key
node.description: A button on a keyboard usually representing letters, numbers, functions, or symbols.
Value of a keyboard key.

node.name: Keypad
node.description: A device consisting of keys, usually in a block arrangement, that provides limited input to a system.

node.name: Keypad-key
node.description: A key on a separate section of a computer keyboard that groups together numeric keys and those for mathematical or other special functions in an arrangement like that of a calculator.
Value of keypad key.

node.name: Microphone
node.description: A device designed to convert sound to an electrical signal.

node.name: Push-button
node.description: A switch designed to be operated by pressing a button.

node.name: Output-device
node.description: Any piece of computer hardware equipment which converts information into human understandable form.

node.name: Display-device
node.description: An output device for presentation of information in visual or tactile form the latter used for example in tactile electronic displays for blind people.

node.name: Head-mounted-display
node.description: An instrument that functions as a display device, worn on the head or as part of a helmet, that has a small display optic in front of one (monocular HMD) or each eye (binocular HMD).

node.name: LED-display
node.description: A LED display is a flat panel display that uses an array of light-emitting diodes as pixels for a video display.

node.name: Computer-screen
node.description: An electronic device designed as a display or a physical device designed to be a protective meshwork.

node.name: Screen-window
node.description: A part of a computer screen that contains a display different from the rest of the screen. A window is a graphical control element consisting of a visual area containing some of the graphical user interface of the program it belongs to and is framed by a window decoration.

node.name: Auditory-device
node.description: A device designed to produce sound.

node.name: Headphones
node.description: An instrument that consists of a pair of small loudspeakers, or less commonly a single speaker, held close to ears and connected to a signal source such as an audio amplifier, radio, CD player or portable media player.

node.name: Loudspeaker
node.description: A device designed to convert electrical signals to sounds that can be heard.

node.name: Recording-device
node.description: A device that copies information in a signal into a persistent information bearer.

node.name: EEG-recorder
node.description: A device for recording electric currents in the brain using electrodes applied to the scalp, to the surface of the brain, or placed within the substance of the brain.

node.name: File-storage
node.description: A device for recording digital information to a permanent media.

node.name: MEG-recorder
node.description: A device for measuring the magnetic fields produced by electrical activity in the brain, usually conducted externally.

node.name: Motion-capture
node.description: A device for recording the movement of objects or people.

node.name: Tape-recorder
node.description: A device for recording and reproduction usually using magnetic tape for storage that can be saved and played back.

node.name: Touchscreen
node.description: A control component that operates an electronic device by pressing the display on the screen.

node.name: Machine
node.description: A human-made device that uses power to apply forces and control movement to perform an action.

node.name: Measurement-device
node.description: A device in which a measure function inheres.

node.name: Clock
node.description: A device designed to indicate the time of day or to measure the time duration of an event or action.

node.name: Clock-face
node.description: A location identifier based on clockface numbering or anatomic subregion.

node.name: Robot
node.description: A mechanical device that sometimes resembles a living animal and is capable of performing a variety of often complex human tasks on command or by being programmed in advance.

node.name: Tool
node.description: A component that is not part of a device but is designed to support its assemby or operation.

node.name: Document
node.description: A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.

node.name: Letter
node.description: A written message addressed to a person or organization.

node.name: Note
node.description: A brief written record.

node.name: Book
node.description: A volume made up of pages fastened along one edge and enclosed between protective covers.

node.name: Notebook
node.description: A book for notes or memoranda.

node.name: Furnishing
node.description: Furniture, fittings, and other decorative accessories, such as curtains and carpets, for a house or room.

node.name: Manufactured-material
node.description: Substances created or extracted from raw materials.

node.name: Ceramic
node.description: A hard, brittle, heat-resistant and corrosion-resistant material made by shaping and then firing a nonmetallic mineral, such as clay, at a high temperature.

node.name: Glass
node.description: A brittle transparent solid with irregular atomic structure.

node.name: Paper
node.description: A thin sheet material produced by mechanically or chemically processing cellulose fibres derived from wood, rags, grasses or other vegetable sources in water.

node.name: Plastic
node.description: Various high-molecular-weight thermoplastic or thermosetting polymers that are capable of being molded, extruded, drawn, or otherwise shaped and then hardened into a form.

node.name: Steel
node.description: An alloy made up of iron with typically a few tenths of a percent of carbon to improve its strength and fracture resistance compared to iron.

node.name: Media
node.description: Media are audo/visual/audiovisual modes of communicating information for mass consumption.

node.name: Media-clip
node.description: A short segment of media.

node.name: Audio-clip
node.description: A short segment of audio.

node.name: Audiovisual-clip
node.description: A short media segment containing both audio and video.

node.name: Video-clip
node.description: A short segment of video.

node.name: Visualization
node.description: An planned process that creates images, diagrams or animations from the input data.

node.name: Animation
node.description: A form of graphical illustration that changes with time to give a sense of motion or represent dynamic changes in the portrayal.

node.name: Art-installation
node.description: A large-scale, mixed-media constructions, often designed for a specific place or for a temporary period of time.

node.name: Braille
node.description: A display using a system of raised dots that can be read with the fingers by people who are blind.

node.name: Image
node.description: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

node.name: Cartoon
node.description: A type of illustration, sometimes animated, typically in a non-realistic or semi-realistic style. The specific meaning has evolved over time, but the modern usage usually refers to either an image or series of images intended for satire, caricature, or humor. A motion picture that relies on a sequence of illustrations for its animation.

node.name: Drawing
node.description: A representation of an object or outlining a figure, plan, or sketch by means of lines.

node.name: Icon
node.description: A sign (such as a word or graphic symbol) whose form suggests its meaning.

node.name: Painting
node.description: A work produced through the art of painting.

node.name: Photograph
node.description: An image recorded by a camera.

node.name: Movie
node.description: A sequence of images displayed in succession giving the illusion of continuous movement.

node.name: Outline-visualization
node.description: A visualization consisting of a line or set of lines enclosing or indicating the shape of an object in a sketch or diagram.

node.name: Point-light-visualization
node.description: A display in which action is depicted using a few points of light, often generated from discrete sensors in motion capture.

node.name: Sculpture
node.description: A two- or three-dimensional representative or abstract forms, especially by carving stone or wood or by casting metal or plaster.

node.name: Stick-figure-visualization
node.description: A drawing showing the head of a human being or animal as a circle and all other parts as straight lines.

node.name: Navigational-object
node.description: An object whose purpose is to assist directed movement from one location to another.

node.name: Path
node.description: A trodden way. A way or track laid down for walking or made by continual treading.

node.name: Road
node.description: An open way for the passage of vehicles, persons, or animals on land.

node.name: Lane
node.description: A defined path with physical dimensions through which an object or substance may traverse.

node.name: Runway
node.description: A paved strip of ground on a landing field for the landing and takeoff of aircraft.

node.name: Vehicle
node.description: A mobile machine which transports people or cargo.

node.name: Aircraft
node.description: A vehicle which is able to travel through air in an atmosphere.

node.name: Bicycle
node.description: A human-powered, pedal-driven, single-track vehicle, having two wheels attached to a frame, one behind the other.

node.name: Boat
node.description: A watercraft of any size which is able to float or plane on water.

node.name: Car
node.description: A wheeled motor vehicle used primarily for the transportation of human passengers.

node.name: Cart
node.description: A cart is a vehicle which has two wheels and is designed to transport human passengers or cargo.

node.name: Tractor
node.description: A mobile machine specifically designed to deliver a high tractive effort at slow speeds, and mainly used for the purposes of hauling a trailer or machinery used in agriculture or construction.

node.name: Train
node.description: A connected line of railroad cars with or without a locomotive.

node.name: Truck
node.description: A motor vehicle which, as its primary funcion, transports cargo rather than human passangers.

node.name: Natural-object
node.description: Something that exists in or is produced by nature, and is not artificial or man-made.

node.name: Mineral
node.description: A solid, homogeneous, inorganic substance occurring in nature and having a definite chemical composition.

node.name: Natural-feature
node.description: A feature that occurs in nature. A prominent or identifiable aspect, region, or site of interest.

node.name: Field
node.description: An unbroken expanse as of ice or grassland.

node.name: Hill
node.description: A rounded elevation of limited extent rising above the surrounding land with local relief of less than 300m.

node.name: Mountain
node.description: A landform that extends above the surrounding terrain in a limited area.

node.name: River
node.description: A natural freshwater surface stream of considerable volume and a permanent or seasonal flow, moving in a definite channel toward a sea, lake, or another river.

node.name: Waterfall
node.description: A sudden descent of water over a step or ledge in the bed of a river.

node.name: Sound
node.description: Mechanical vibrations transmitted by an elastic medium. Something that can be heard.

node.name: Environmental-sound
node.description: Sounds occuring in the environment. An accumulation of noise pollution that occurs outside. This noise can be caused by transport, industrial, and recreational activities.

node.name: Crowd-sound
node.description: Noise produced by a mixture of sounds from a large group of people.

node.name: Signal-noise
node.description: Any part of a signal that is not the true or original signal but is introduced by the communication mechanism.

node.name: Musical-sound
node.description: Sound produced by continuous and regular vibrations, as opposed to noise.

node.name: Tone
node.description: A musical note, warble, or other sound used as a particular signal on a telephone or answering machine.

node.name: Instrument-sound
node.description: Sound produced by a musical instrument.

node.name: Vocalized-sound
node.description: Musical sound produced by vocal cords in a biological agent.

node.name: Named-animal-sound
node.description: A sound recognizable as being associated with particular animals.

node.name: Barking
node.description: Sharp explosive cries like sounds made by certain animals, especially a dog, fox, or seal.

node.name: Bleating
node.description: Wavering cries like sounds made by a sheep, goat, or calf.

node.name: Crowing
node.description: Loud shrill sounds characteristic of roosters.

node.name: Chirping
node.description: Short, sharp, high-pitched noises like sounds made by small birds or an insects.

node.name: Growling
node.description: Low guttural sounds like those that made in the throat by a hostile dog or other animal.

node.name: Meowing
node.description: Vocalizations like those made by as those cats. These sounds have diverse tones and are sometimes chattered, murmured or whispered. The purpose can be assertive.

node.name: Mooing
node.description: Deep vocal sounds like those made by a cow.

node.name: Purring
node.description: Low continuous vibratory sound such as those made by cats. The sound expresses contentment.

node.name: Roaring
node.description: Loud, deep, or harsh prolonged sounds such as those made by big cats and bears for long-distance communication and intimidation.

node.name: Squawking
node.description: Loud, harsh noises such as those made by geese.

node.name: Named-object-sound
node.description: A sound identifiable as coming from a particular type of object.

node.name: Alarm-sound
node.description: A loud signal often loud continuous ringing to alert people to a problem or condition that requires urgent attention.

node.name: Beep
node.description: A short, single tone, that is typically high-pitched and generally made by a computer or other machine.

node.name: Buzz
node.description: A persistent vibratory sound often made by a buzzer device and used to indicate something incorrect.

node.name: Ka-ching
node.description: The sound made by a mechanical cash register, often to designate a reward.

node.name: Click
node.description: The sound made by a mechanical cash register, often to designate a reward.

node.name: Ding
node.description: A short ringing sound such as that made by a bell, often to indicate a correct response or the expiration of time.

node.name: Horn-blow
node.description: A loud sound made by forcing air through a sound device that funnels air to create the sound, often used to sound an alert.

node.name: Siren
node.description: A loud, continuous sound often varying in frequency designed to indicate an emergency.

node.name: Property
node.description: Something that pertains to a thing. A characteristic of some entity. A quality or feature regarded as a characteristic or inherent part of someone or something. HED attributes are adjectives or adverbs.

node.name: Agent-property
node.description: Something that pertains to an agent.

node.name: Agent-state
node.description: The state of the agent.

node.name: Agent-cognitive-state
node.description: The state of the cognitive processes or state of mind of the agent.

node.name: Alert
node.description: Condition of heightened watchfulness or preparation for action.

node.name: Anesthetized
node.description: Having lost sensation to pain or having senses dulled due to the effects of an anesthetic.

node.name: Asleep
node.description: Having entered a periodic, readily reversible state of reduced awareness and metabolic activity, usually accompanied by physical relaxation and brain activity.

node.name: Attentive
node.description: Concentrating and focusing mental energy on the task or surroundings.

node.name: Awake
node.description: In a non sleeping state.

node.name: Brain-dead
node.description: Characterized by the irreversible absence of cortical and brain stem functioning.

node.name: Comatose
node.description: In a state of profound unconsciousness associated with markedly depressed cerebral activity.

node.name: Drowsy
node.description: In a state of near-sleep, a strong desire for sleep, or sleeping for unusually long periods.

node.name: Intoxicated
node.description: In a state with disturbed psychophysiological functions and responses as a result of administration or ingestion of a psychoactive substance.

node.name: Locked-in
node.description: In a state of complete paralysis of all voluntary muscles except for the ones that control the movements of the eyes.

node.name: Passive
node.description: Not responding or initiating an action in response to a stimulus.

node.name: Resting
node.description: A state in which the agent is not exhibiting any physical exertion.

node.name: Vegetative
node.description: A state of wakefulness and conscience, but (in contrast to coma) with involuntary opening of the eyes and movements (such as teeth grinding, yawning, or thrashing of the extremities).

node.name: Agent-emotional-state
node.description: The status of the general temperament and outlook of an agent.

node.name: Angry
node.description: Experiencing emotions characterized by marked annoyance or hostility.

node.name: Aroused
node.description: In a state reactive to stimuli leading to increased heart rate and blood pressure, sensory alertness, mobility and readiness to respond.

node.name: Awed
node.description: Filled with wonder. Feeling grand, sublime or powerful emotions characterized by a combination of joy, fear, admiration, reverence, and/or respect.

node.name: Compassionate
node.description: Feeling or showing sympathy and concern for others often evoked for a person who is in distress and associated with altruistic motivation.

node.name: Content
node.description: Feeling satisfaction with things as they are.

node.name: Disgusted
node.description: Feeling revulsion or profound disapproval aroused by something unpleasant or offensive.

node.name: Emotionally-neutral
node.description: Feeling neither satisfied nor dissatisfied.

node.name: Empathetic
node.description: Understanding and sharing the feelings of another. Being aware of, being sensitive to, and vicariously experiencing the feelings, thoughts, and experience of another.

node.name: Excited
node.description: Feeling great enthusiasm and eagerness.

node.name: Fearful
node.description: Feeling apprehension that one may be in danger.

node.name: Frustrated
node.description: Feeling annoyed as a result of being blocked, thwarted, disappointed or defeated.

node.name: Grieving
node.description: Feeling sorrow in response to loss, whether physical or abstract.

node.name: Happy
node.description: Feeling pleased and content.

node.name: Jealous
node.description: Feeling threatened by a rival in a relationship with another individual, in particular an intimate partner, usually involves feelings of threat, fear, suspicion, distrust, anxiety, anger, betrayal, and rejection.

node.name: Joyful
node.description: Feeling delight or intense happiness.

node.name: Loving
node.description: Feeling a strong positive emotion of affection and attraction.

node.name: Relieved
node.description: No longer feeling pain, distress, anxiety, or reassured.

node.name: Sad
node.description: Feeling grief or unhappiness.

node.name: Stressed
node.description: Experiencing mental or emotional strain or tension.

node.name: Agent-physiological-state
node.description: Having to do with the mechanical, physical, or biochemical function of an agent.

node.name: Healthy
node.description: Having no significant health-related issues.

node.name: Hungry
node.description: Being in a state of craving or desiring food.

node.name: Rested
node.description: Feeling refreshed and relaxed.

node.name: Sated
node.description: Feeling full.

node.name: Sick
node.description: Being in a state of ill health, bodily malfunction, or discomfort.

node.name: Thirsty
node.description: Feeling a need to drink.

node.name: Tired
node.description: Feeling in need of sleep or rest.

node.name: Agent-postural-state
node.description: Pertaining to the position in which agent holds their body.

node.name: Crouching
node.description: Adopting a position where the knees are bent and the upper body is brought forward and down, sometimes to avoid detection or to defend oneself.

node.name: Eyes-closed
node.description: Keeping eyes closed with no blinking.

node.name: Eyes-open
node.description: Keeping eyes open with occasional blinking.

node.name: Kneeling
node.description: Positioned where one or both knees are on the ground.

node.name: On-treadmill
node.description: Ambulation on an exercise apparatus with an endless moving belt to support moving in place.

node.name: Prone
node.description: Positioned in a recumbent body position whereby the person lies on its stomach and faces downward.

node.name: Sitting
node.description: In a seated position.

node.name: Standing
node.description: Assuming or maintaining an erect upright position.

node.name: Seated-with-chin-rest
node.description: Using a device that supports the chin and head.

node.name: Agent-task-role
node.description: The function or part that is ascribed to an agent in performing the task.

node.name: Experiment-actor
node.description: An agent who plays a predetermined role to create the experiment scenario.

node.name: Experiment-controller
node.description: An agent exerting control over some aspect of the experiment.

node.name: Experiment-participant
node.description: Someone who takes part in an activity related to an experiment.

node.name: Experimenter
node.description: Person who is the owner of the experiment and has its responsibility.

node.name: Agent-trait
node.description: A genetically, environmentally, or socially determined characteristic of an agent.

node.name: Age
node.description: Length of time elapsed time since birth of the agent.

node.name: Agent-experience-level
node.description: Amount of skill or knowledge that the agent has as pertains to the task.

node.name: Expert-level
node.description: Having comprehensive and authoritative knowledge of or skill in a particular area related to the task.

node.name: Intermediate-experience-level
node.description: Having a moderate amount of knowledge or skill related to the task.

node.name: Novice-level
node.description: Being inexperienced in a field or situation related to the task.

node.name: Gender
node.description: Characteristics that are socially constructed, including norms, behaviors, and roles based on sex.

node.name: Sex
node.description: Physical properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female.

node.name: Female
node.description: Biological sex of an individual with female sexual organs such ova.

node.name: Male
node.description: Biological sex of an individual with male sexual organs producing sperm.

node.name: Intersex
node.description: Having genitalia and/or secondary sexual characteristics of indeterminate sex.

node.name: Handedness
node.description: Individual preference for use of a hand, known as the dominant hand.

node.name: Left-handed
node.description: Preference for using the left hand or foot for tasks requiring the use of a single hand or foot.

node.name: Right-handed
node.description: Preference for using the right hand or foot for tasks requiring the use of a single hand or foot.

node.name: Ambidextrous
node.description: Having no overall dominance in the use of right or left hand or foot in the performance of tasks that require one hand or foot.

node.name: Data-property
node.description: Something that pertains to data or information.

node.name: Data-marker
node.description: An indicator placed to mark something.

node.name: Temporal-marker
node.description: An indicator placed at a particular time in the data.

node.name: Onset
node.description: Labels the start or beginning of something, usually an event.

node.name: Offset
node.description: Labels the time at which something stops.

node.name: Pause
node.description: Indicates the temporary interruption of the operation a process and subsequently wait for a signal to continue.

node.name: Time-out
node.description: A cancellation or cessation that automatically occurs when a predefined interval of time has passed without a certain event occurring.

node.name: Time-sync
node.description: A synchronization signal whose purpose to help synchronize different signals or processes. Often used to indicate a marker inserted into the recorded data to allow post hoc synchronization of concurrently recorded data streams.

node.name: Data-resolution
node.description: Smallest change in a quality being measured by an sensor that causes a perceptible change.

node.name: Printer-resolution
node.description: Resolution of a printer, usually expressed as the number of dots-per-inch for a printer.

node.name: Screen-resolution
node.description: Resolution of a screen, usually expressed as the of pixels in a dimension for a digital display device.

node.name: Sensory-resolution
node.description: Resolution of measurements by a sensing device.

node.name: Spatial-resolution
node.description: Linear spacing of a spatial measurement.

node.name: Spectral-resolution
node.description: Measures the ability of a sensor to resolve features in the electromagnetic spectrum.

node.name: Temporal-resolution
node.description: Measures the ability of a sensor to resolve features in time.

node.name: Data-source-type
node.description: The type of place, person, or thing from which the data comes or can be obtained.

node.name: Computed-feature
node.description: A feature computed from the data by a tool. This tag should be grouped with a label of the form Toolname_propertyName.

node.name: Computed-prediction
node.description: A computed extrapolation of known data.

node.name: Expert-annotation
node.description: An explanatory or critical comment or other in-context information provided by an authority.

node.name: Instrument-measurement
node.description: Information obtained from a device that is used to measure material properties or make other observations.

node.name: Observation
node.description: Active acquisition of information from a primary source. Should be grouped with a label of the form AgentID_featureName.

node.name: Data-value
node.description: Designation of the type of a data item.

node.name: Categorical-value
node.description: Indicates that something can take on a limited and usually fixed number of possible values.

node.name: Categorical-class-value
node.description: Categorical values that fall into discrete classes such as true or false. The grouping is absolute in the sense that it is the same for all participants.

node.name: All
node.description: To a complete degree or to the full or entire extent.

node.name: Correct
node.description: Free from error. Especially conforming to fact or truth.

node.name: Explicit
node.description: Stated clearly and in detail, leaving no room for confusion or doubt.

node.name: False
node.description: Not in accordance with facts, reality or definitive criteria.

node.name: Implicit
node.description: Implied though not plainly expressed.

node.name: Invalid
node.description: Not true because based on erroneous information or unsound reasoning or not conforming to the correct format or specifications.

node.name: None
node.description: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

node.name: Some
node.description: At least a small amount or number of, but not a large amount of, or often.

node.name: True
node.description: Conforming to facts, reality or definitive criteria.

node.name: Valid
node.description: Allowable, usable, or acceptable.

node.name: Wrong
node.description: Not accurate, correct, or appropriate.

node.name: Categorical-judgment-value
node.description: Categorical values that are based on the judgment or perception of the participant such familiar and famous.

node.name: Abnormal
node.description: Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.

node.name: Asymmetrical
node.description: Lacking symmetry or having parts that fail to correspond to one another in shape, size, or arrangement.

node.name: Audible
node.description: A sound that can be perceived by the participant.

node.name: Congruent
node.description: Concordance of multiple evidence lines. In agreement or harmony.

node.name: Complex
node.description: Hard, involved or complicated, elaborate, having many parts.

node.name: Constrained
node.description: Keeping something within particular limits or bounds.

node.name: Disordered
node.description: Not neatly arranged. Confused and untidy. A structural quality in which the parts of an object are non-rigid.

node.name: Familiar
node.description: Recognized, familiar, or within the scope of knowledge.

node.name: Famous
node.description: A person who has a high degree of recognition by the general population for his or her success or accomplishments. A famous person.

node.name: Inaudible
node.description: A sound below the threshold of perception of the participant.

node.name: Incongruent
node.description: Not in agreement or harmony.

node.name: Involuntary
node.description: An action that is not made by choice. In the body, involuntary actions (such as blushing) occur automatically, and cannot be controlled by choice.

node.name: Masked
node.description: Information exists but is not provided or is partially obscured due to security, privacy, or other concerns.

node.name: Normal
node.description: Being approximately average or within certain limits. Conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

node.name: Ordered
node.description: Conforming to a logical or comprehensible arrangement of separate elements.

node.name: Simple
node.description: Easily understood or presenting no difficulties.

node.name: Symmetrical
node.description: Made up of exactly similar parts facing each other or around an axis. Showing aspects of symmetry.

node.name: Unconstrained
node.description: Moving without restriction.

node.name: Unfamiliar
node.description: Not having knowledge or experience of.

node.name: Unmasked
node.description: Information is revealed.

node.name: Voluntary
node.description: Using free will or design; not forced or compelled; controlled by individual volition.

node.name: Categorical-level-value
node.description: Categorical values based on dividing a continuous variable into levels such as high and low.

node.name: Cold
node.description: Characterized by an absence of heat.

node.name: Deep
node.description: Extending relatively far inward or downward.

node.name: High
node.description: Having a greater than normal degree, intensity, or amount.

node.name: Hot
node.description: Characterized by an excess of heat.

node.name: Liminal
node.description: Situated at a sensory threshold that is barely perceptible or capable of eliciting a response.

node.name: Loud
node.description: Characterizing a perceived high intensity of sound.

node.name: Low
node.description: Less than normal in degree, intensity or amount.

node.name: Medium
node.description: Mid-way between small and large in number, quantity, magnitude or extent.

node.name: Negative
node.description: Involving disadvantage or harm.

node.name: Positive
node.description: Involving advantage or good.

node.name: Quiet
node.description: Characterizing a perceived low intensity of sound.

node.name: Rough
node.description: Having a surface with perceptible bumps, ridges, or irregularities.

node.name: Shallow
node.description: Having a depth which is relatively low.

node.name: Smooth
node.description: Having a surface free from bumps, ridges, or irregularities.

node.name: Subliminal
node.description: Situated below a sensory threshold that is imperceptible or not capable of eliciting a response.

node.name: Supraliminal
node.description: Situated above a sensory threshold that is perceptible or capable of eliciting a response.

node.name: Thick
node.description: Wide in width, extent or cross-section.

node.name: Thin
node.description: Narrow in width, extent or cross-section.

node.name: Categorical-orientation-value
node.description: Value indicating the orientation or direction of something.

node.name: Backward
node.description: Directed behind or to the rear.

node.name: Downward
node.description: Moving or leading toward a lower place or level.

node.name: Forward
node.description: At or near or directed toward the front.

node.name: Horizontally-oriented
node.description: Oriented parallel to or in the plane of the horizon.

node.name: Leftward
node.description: Going toward or facing the left.

node.name: Oblique
node.description: Slanting or inclined in direction, course, or position that is neither parallel nor perpendicular nor right-angular.

node.name: Rightward
node.description: Going toward or situated on the right.

node.name: Rotated
node.description: Positioned offset around an axis or center.

node.name: Upward
node.description: Moving, pointing, or leading to a higher place, point, or level.

node.name: Vertically-oriented
node.description: Oriented perpendicular to the plane of the horizon.

node.name: Physical-value
node.description: The value of some physical property of something.

node.name: Weight
node.description: The relative mass or the quantity of matter contained by something.

node.name: Quantitative-value
node.description: Something capable of being estimated or expressed with numeric values.

node.name: Fraction
node.description: A numerical value betwee 0 and 1.

node.name: Item-count
node.description: The integer count of something which is usually grouped with the entity it is counting. (Item-count/3, A) indicates that 3 of A have occurred up to this point.

node.name: Item-interval
node.description: An integer indicating how many items or entities have passed since the last one of these. An item interval of 0 indicates the current item.

node.name: Percentage
node.description: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

node.name: Ratio
node.description: A quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.

node.name: Statistical-value
node.description: A value based on or employing the principles of statistics.

node.name: Data-maximum
node.description: The largest possible quantity or degree.

node.name: Data-mean
node.description: The sum of a set of values divided by the number of values in the set.

node.name: Data-median
node.description: The value which has an equal number of values greater and less than it.

node.name: Data-minimum
node.description: The smallest possible quantity.

node.name: Probability
node.description: A measure of the expectation of the occurrence of a particular event.

node.name: Standard-deviation
node.description: A measure of the range of values in a set of numbers. Standard deviation is a statistic used as a measure of the dispersion or variation in a distribution, equal to the square root of the arithmetic mean of the squares of the deviations from the arithmetic mean.

node.name: Statistical-accuracy
node.description: A measure of closeness to true value expressed as a number between 0 and 1.

node.name: Statistical-precision
node.description: A quantitative representation of the degree of accuracy necessary for or associated with a particular action.

node.name: Statistical-recall
node.description: Sensitivity is a measurement datum qualifying a binary classification test and is computed by substracting the false negative rate to the integral numeral 1.

node.name: Statistical-uncertainty
node.description: A measure of the inherent variability of repeated observation measurements of a quantity including quantities evaluated by statistical methods and by other means.

node.name: Spatiotemporal-value
node.description: A property relating to space and/or time.

node.name: Rate-of-change
node.description: The amount of change accumulated per unit time.

node.name: Acceleration
node.description: Magnitude of the rate of change in either speed or direction. The direction of change should be given separately.

node.name: Frequency
node.description: Frequency is the number of occurrences of a repeating event per unit time.

node.name: Jerk-rate
node.description: Magnitude of the rate at which the acceleration of an object changes with respect to time. The direction of change should be given separately.

node.name: Sampling-rate
node.description: The number of digital samples taken or recorded per unit of time.

node.name: Refresh-rate
node.description: The frequency with which the image on a computer monitor or similar electronic display screen is refreshed, usually expressed in hertz.

node.name: Speed
node.description: A scalar measure of the rate of movement of the object expressed either as the distance travelled divided by the time taken (average speed) or the rate of change of position with respect to time at a particular point (instantaneous speed). The direction of change should be given separately.

node.name: Temporal-rate
node.description: The number of items per unit of time.

node.name: Spatial-value
node.description: Value of an item involving space.

node.name: Angle
node.description: The amount of inclination of one line to another or the plane of one object to another.

node.name: Distance
node.description: A measure of the space separating two objects or points.

node.name: Position
node.description: A reference to the alignment of an object, a particular situation or view of a situation, or the location of an object. Coordinates with respect a specified frame of reference or the default Screen-frame if no frame is given.

node.name: X-position
node.description: The position along the x-axis of the frame of reference.

node.name: Y-position
node.description: The position along the y-axis of the frame of reference.

node.name: Z-position
node.description: The position along the z-axis of the frame of reference.

node.name: Size
node.description: The physical magnitude of something.

node.name: Area
node.description: The extent of a 2-dimensional surface enclosed within a boundary.

node.name: Depth
node.description: The distance from the surface of something especially from the perspective of looking from the front.

node.name: Length
node.description: The linear extent in space from one end of something to the other end, or the extent of something from beginning to end.

node.name: Width
node.description: The extent or measurement of something from side to side.

node.name: Height
node.description: The vertical measurement or distance from the base to the top of an object.

node.name: Volume
node.description: The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

node.name: Temporal-value
node.description: A characteristic of or relating to time or limited by time.

node.name: Delay
node.description: Time during which some action is awaited.

node.name: Duration
node.description: The period of time during which something occurs or continues.

node.name: Time-interval
node.description: The period of time separating two instances, events, or occurrences.

node.name: Time-value
node.description: A value with units of time. Usually grouped with tags identifying what the value represents.

node.name: Data-variability-attribute
node.description: An attribute describing how something changes or varies.

node.name: Abrupt
node.description: Marked by sudden change.

node.name: Constant
node.description: Continually recurring or continuing without interruption. Not changing in time or space.

node.name: Continuous
node.description: Uninterrupted in time, sequence, substance, or extent.

node.name: Decreasing
node.description: Becoming smaller or fewer in size, amount, intensity, or degree.

node.name: Deterministic
node.description: No randomness is involved in the development of the future states of the element.

node.name: Discontinuous
node.description: Having a gap in time, sequence, substance, or extent.

node.name: Discrete
node.description: Constituting a separate entities or parts.

node.name: Flickering
node.description: Moving irregularly or unsteadily or burning or shining fitfully or with a fluctuating light.

node.name: Estimated-value
node.description: Something that has been calculated or measured approximately.

node.name: Exact-value
node.description: A value that is viewed to the true value according to some standard.

node.name: Fractal
node.description: Having extremely irregular curves or shapes for which any suitably chosen part is similar in shape to a given larger or smaller part when magnified or reduced to the same size.

node.name: Increasing
node.description: Becoming greater in size, amount, or degree.

node.name: Random
node.description: Governed by or depending on chance. Lacking any definite plan or order or purpose.

node.name: Repetitive
node.description: A recurring action that is often non-purposeful.

node.name: Stochastic
node.description: Uses a random probability distribution or pattern that may be analysed statistically but may not be predicted precisely to determine future states.

node.name: Varying
node.description: Differing in size, amount, degree, or nature.

node.name: Environmental-property
node.description: Relating to or arising from the surroundings of an agent.

node.name: Indoors
node.description: Located inside a building or enclosure.

node.name: Outdoors
node.description: Any area outside a building or shelter.

node.name: Real-world
node.description: Located in a place that exists in real space and time under realistic conditions.

node.name: Virtual-world
node.description: Using technology that creates immersive, computer-generated experiences that a person can interact with and navigate through. The digital content is generally delivered to the user through some type of headset and responds to changes in head position or through interaction with other types of sensors. Existing in a virtual setting such as a simulation or game environment.

node.name: Augmented-reality
node.description: Using technology that enhances real-world experiences with computer-derived digital overlays to change some aspects of perception of the natural environment. The digital content is shown to the user through a smart device or glasses and responds to changes in the environment.

node.name: Motion-platform
node.description: A mechanism that creates the feelings of being in a real motion environment.

node.name: Urban
node.description: Relating to, located in, or characteristic of a city or densely populated area.

node.name: Rural
node.description: Of or pertaining to the country as opposed to the city.

node.name: Terrain
node.description: Characterization of the physical features of a tract of land.

node.name: Composite-terrain
node.description: Tracts of land characterized by a mixure of physical features.

node.name: Dirt-terrain
node.description: Tracts of land characterized by a soil surface and lack of vegetation.

node.name: Grassy-terrain
node.description: Tracts of land covered by grass.

node.name: Gravel-terrain
node.description: Tracts of land covered by a surface consisting a loose aggregation of small water-worn or pounded stones.

node.name: Leaf-covered-terrain
node.description: Tracts of land covered by leaves and composited organic material.

node.name: Muddy-terrain
node.description: Tracts of land covered by a liquid or semi-liquid mixture of water and some combination of soil, silt, and clay.

node.name: Paved-terrain
node.description: Tracts of land covered with concrete, asphalt, stones, or bricks.

node.name: Rocky-terrain
node.description: Tracts of land consisting or full of rock or rocks.

node.name: Sloped-terrain
node.description: Tracts of land arranged in a sloping or inclined position.

node.name: Uneven-terrain
node.description: Tracts of land that are not level, smooth, or regular.

node.name: Informational-property
node.description: Something that pertains to a task.

node.name: Description
node.description: An explanation of what the tag group it is in means. If the description is at the top-level of an event string, the description applies to the event.

node.name: ID
node.description: An alphanumeric name that identifies either a unique object or a unique class of objects. Here the object or class may be an idea, physical countable object (or class), or physical uncountable substance (or class).

node.name: Label
node.description: A string of 20 or fewer characters identifying something. Labels usually refer to general classes of things while IDs refer to specific instances. A term that is associated with some entity. A brief description given for purposes of identification. An identifying or descriptive marker that is attached to an object.

node.name: Metadata
node.description: Data about data. Information that describes another set of data.

node.name: CogAtlas
node.description: The Cognitive Atlas ID number of something.

node.name: CogPo
node.description: The CogPO ID number of something.

node.name: Creation-date
node.description: The date on which data creation of this element began.

node.name: Experimental-note
node.description: A brief written record about the experiment.

node.name: Library-name
node.description: Official name of a HED library.

node.name: OBO-identifier
node.description: The identifier of a term in some Open Biology Ontology (OBO) ontology.

node.name: Pathname
node.description: The specification of a node (file or directory) in a hierarchical file system, usually specified by listing the nodes top-down.

node.name: Subject-identifier
node.description: A sequence of characters used to identify, name, or characterize a trial or study subject.

node.name: Version-identifier
node.description: An alphanumeric character string that identifies a form or variant of a type or original.
Usually is a semantic version.

node.name: Parameter
node.description: Something user-defined for this experiment.

node.name: Parameter-label
node.description: The name of the parameter.

node.name: Parameter-value
node.description: The value of the parameter.

node.name: Organizational-property
node.description: Relating to an organization or the action of organizing something.

node.name: Collection
node.description: A tag designating a grouping of items such as in a set or list.
Name of the collection.

node.name: Condition-variable
node.description: An aspect of the experiment or task that is to be varied during the experiment. Task-conditions are sometimes called independent variables or contrasts.
Name of the condition variable.

node.name: Control-variable
node.description: An aspect of the experiment that is fixed throughout the study and usually is explicitly controlled.
Name of the control variable.

node.name: Def
node.description: A HED-specific utility tag used with a defined name to represent the tags associated with that definition.
Name of the definition.

node.name: Def-expand
node.description: A HED specific utility tag that is grouped with an expanded definition. The child value of the Def-expand is the name of the expanded definition.

node.name: Definition
